overview_of_class: This course is designed for non-biology majors as an introduction to the life sciences and to encourage scientific curiosity. Students will learn about the mode of inheritance, genetic engineering and to explore Darwinian Evolution. The application of genetics and evolution to everyday life and the impact on society will also be addressed. A deep understanding of genetic processes will be provided, granting students a platform to form knowledgeable opinions on today's most popular scientific controversies, including genetically modified organisms (GMO's). There are no prerequisites for this course.
name: Genetics and Evolution
subject: BIOL_SCI
